input.description: The name of the adapter to use to handle the request. Default adapter name: HPSMActor.

The items for the adapter request. This should be an XML document with a root element named "items" having a child "item", which should contain the data necessary to execute the specific request.
Update Contact
This wrapper updates a Contact.
Sample Item Xml:
<items> <item> <operation-name>update-contact</operation-name> <model> <keys> <contact-name> <value>MyContactName2</value> <type>String</type> </contact-name> </keys> <instance> <contact-name> <value>MyContactName2</value> <type>String</type> </contact-name> <employee-i-d> <value>employee i d-updated</value> <type>String</type> </employee-i-d> <shift> <value>Shift</value> <type>String</type> </shift> <department> <value>department</value> <type>String</type> </department> <last-name> <value>last name</value> <type>String</type> </last-name> <first-name> <value>first name</value> <type>String</type> </first-name> <work-phone> <value>Work phone</value> <type>String</type> </work-phone> <extension> <value>Extension</value> <type>String</type> </extension> <location> <value>Location</value> <type>String</type> </location> <floor> <value>Floor</value> <type>String</type> </floor> <email> <value>Email</value> <type>String</type> </email> <home-phone> <value>Home phone</value> <type>String</type> </home-phone> <primary-configuration-item> <value>Primary Configuration Item</value> <type>String</type> </primary-configuration-item> <building> <value>Building</value> <type>String</type> </building> <mobile-phone> <value>Portable</value> <type>String</type> </mobile-phone> <company> <value>Company</value> <type>String</type> </company> <manager> <value>Manager</value> <type>String</type> </manager> <contract-i-d> <value>19</value> <type>Decimal</type> </contract-i-d> <critical-user> <value>true</value> <type>Boolean</type> </critical-user> <requires-entitlement> <value>true</value> <type>Boolean</type> </requires-entitlement> <full-name> <value>FullNamenew</value> <type>String</type> </full-name> </instance> </model> </item> </items> Elements’ Description:
Update Process takes place as follows:-
The record is fetched by the information provided in the <keys> element.
Once the record is found, the fields are updated by the information provided in <instance> element. i.e., the respective fields of located record are replaced by the elements’ values that are provided in <instance> element.
NOTE: While locating a record, complete matching of key is required. This means if you give key value to be “abc” and there is a record in the application repository which has key element as “abc123” then this record will not be located for the update.
Modification/Update in located record is done in following manner-
Suppose a random element exists with name <random-element> which has an 'fieldValue1' as its value. i.e. on retrieving, we'll get.
<instance> ... ...
<random-element> <value>fieldValue1</value> <type>fieldType<type> </random-element> ... ... </instance>
Now see following cases of updation-
Case-1: <instance> </instance>
i.e., we don't provide even the element <random-element> Result: the field is not updated.
Case-2: <instance> <random-element> <value></value> <type>fieldType<type> </random-element> </instance>
i.e., we don't provide anything inside <value> element (child of element <random-element>.) Result: the field gets ignored, i.e. not updated.
Case-3: <instance> <random-element> <value> </value> <type>fieldType<type> </random-element> </instance>
i.e., we provide an space character " " (or more contiguous space characters, like " ") inside <value> element (child of element <random-element>.) Result: the field gets updated, and the field <random-elements> is set to blank ""(compare with space character " ".)
Case-4: <instance> <random-element> <value>fieldValue2</value> <type>fieldType<type> </random-element> </instance>
i.e., we provide "fieldValue2" inside <value> element (child of element <random-element>.) Result: the value "fieldValue2" is set to field of <random-element>.
NOTE: One can update the key elements too. Required elements cannot be set to blank.
Complete Elements’ Description:
item [Required]: This is a child of <items>. This <item> tag can be multiple times to support "multiple items support".
operation-name [Required]:
This specifies the operation that needs to be performed.
Valid values: <operation-name>update-contact</operation-name> is valid operation name element.
model [Required]: It is the parent tag for containing all other tags.
keys [Required]: used to ask application to search for the record with the elements inside it.
Instance [Required] : It can have several child elements. The children of this element describe fields of a record.
contact-name[Optional]: Contact name field.
Name of this element in the application: Business > Contact Name.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Values: Ignored.
Note: this tag can be child of <keys> and <instance> both. It is a required tag under <keys> and optional tag under <instance>. We provide it under <keys> to locate the 'Contact' to be updated and we provide it under <instance> to specify the new desired value of <contact-name> tag to be updated.
Employee-i-d [Optional]: The id if employee.
Name of this element in the application: Business > Employee ID.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Shift [Optional]: a field in the contact record.
Name of this field in the application: Business > Shift.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Department[Optional]: The department field.
Name of this field in the application: Business > Dept Name
Valid Values: any valid department name which corresponds to the selected "Company" field.
Default Value: Ignored.
Last-name[Optional]: the last name.
Name of this element in the application: This field is hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
First-name[Optional]: The first name.
Name of this element in the application: this field is hidden.
Valid values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Work-phone[Optional]: the work phone related to the record.
Name of this element in the application: Contact Numbers > Work.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default value: Ignored.
Extension[Optional]: The extension number.
Name of this element in the application: Contact Numbers > Extension.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Location [Optional]: The location information.
Name of this element in the application: Address > Location.
Valid values: Any string.
Default value: Ignored.
Floor[Optional] : A field in the address.
Name of this element in the application: Address > Floor.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Email [Optional]: the email id.
Name of this element in the application: Business > Email.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Home-phone[Optional]: Home phone number.
Name of this element in the application: Contact Numbers > Home.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: Ignored.
Primary-configuration-item [Optional]: The primary item type.
Name of this element in the application: Business > Primary Configuration Item.
Valid values: Any string.

Building[Optional]: the building information.
Name of this element in the application: Address > Building.
Valid Values: Any string.

Mobile-phone[Optional]: the mobile phone number.
Name of this element in the application: Contact Numbers > Portable.
Valid values: Any string.

Company[Optional]: The company information related to the record.
Name of this element in the application: Business > Company.
Valid Values: Any string, or you can select any existing record form the application repository.

Name of this field in the application: Business > Manager.

Contract-i-d[Optional]: the contract id.

Critical-user[Optional]: to tell whether the user is critical or not.
Name of this element in the application: Business > Critical User(Check Box)
Valid Values: true/ false.

Requires-entitlement[Optional]: to tell whether user requires entitlement.
Name of this element in the application: Business > Requires Entitlement(Check Box)
Valid Values: true/false

Full-name [Optional]: the full name of the user.

Provide username/password in form of xml.
This input parameter is required when the user wants to override the default values for username and password provided in the adapter configuration. This is required for cases where an operation cannot be executed with the default username/password provided in the adapter configuration and only user with special permissions can execute the operation. Examples of such operations can be - 'approve-change', 'deny-change', 'close-change', 'approve-task'
Sample XML Format:
<connection-parameters> <alternate-username>USERNAME</alternate-username> <alternate-password>PASSWORD</alternate-password> </connection-parameters>
